subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 25 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Henry completes move to Barcelona
Thierry Henry signs for Barcelona from Arsenal after passing his medical for the Spanish club.



 
Nugent delays decision over move
Preston's £7m-rated striker David Nugent has gone on holiday with his future still undecided.



 
Onuoha pens new Man City contract
Man City defender Nedum Onuoha  signs a new four-year deal at Eastlands.








GOLF




Monty hires Casey's former caddie
Colin Montgomerie is to employ caddie Craig Connolly, who recently split with Paul Casey, for the French Open.



 
Fasth holds on to thwart Langer
Niclas Fasth wins the BMW International Open by two shots from Jose-Filipe Lima and Bernhard Langer.



 
Mahan pips Williamson in play-off
Hunter Mahan birdies the first extra hole to beat Jay Williams in a play-off for the Travelers Championship.








MOTORSPORT




Stoner scorches to Donington win
Championship leader Casey Stoner produces another dominant display to win the British MotoGP.



 
Ferrari mechanic denies sabotage
Ferrari technical manager Nigel Stepney denies allegations of sabotage made against him by the F1 team.



 
Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.








FORMULA ONE




Ferrari mechanic denies sabotage
Ferrari technical manager Nigel Stepney denies allegations of sabotage made against him by the F1 team.



 
Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.



 
Hamilton - I can hold off Alonso
Lewis Hamilton believes he has a competitive edge over Fernando Alonso that could see him crowned F1 champion.








ATHLETICS




Gay claims stunning sprint double
Tyson Gay follows his season-best 100m time in the US Championships by running the second fastest 200m of all time.



 
Devonish leads GB to fourth place
Britain's men finish fourth in the European Cup, while the women secure promotion back to the top flight.



 
Superb Pickering leads GB charge
Craig Pickering wins the 100m to leave Britain's men in fourth place at the European Cup.








CYCLING




Cavendish can be a star - Museeuw
Belgian cycling great Johan Museeuw believes Mark Cavendish can help take cycling to a wider audience in Britain.



 
Cooke retains Grande Boucle title
Nicole Cooke successfully defends her Grande Boucle Feminine title by winning the 2007 tour in France.



 
Karpets wins Tour of Switzerland
Russia's Vladimir Karpets of the Caisse d'Epargne team wins the Tour of Switzerland.








FUN AND GAMES




Teesside tennis
Robbo wonders what would happen if Wimbledon came to the north east



 
Ten to Tackle
How much can you remember about the past week's sport?



 
Dutch courage
Robbo has the answer to why England never win penalty shoot-outs
